name: List public gists for the specified user

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

name: List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will return all public gists

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

name: List all public gists

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description:
List all public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.

Note: With [pagination](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.14/v3/#pagination), you can fetch up to 3000 gists. For example, you can fetch 100 pages with 30 gists per page or 30 pages with 100 gists per page.

name: List starred gists

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: List the authenticated user's starred gists:

hello_world.rb.content:
class HelloWorld
   def initialize(name)
      @name = name.capitalize
   end
   def sayHi
      puts "Hello !"
   end
end

hello = HelloWorld.new("World")
hello.sayHi

hello_world_ruby.txt.content: Run `ruby hello_world.rb` to print Hello World

hello_world_python.txt.content: Run `python hello_world.py` to print Hello World

name: Create a gist

params.name: files
params.description: The filenames and content of each file in the gist. The keys in the `files` object represent the filename and have the type `string`.

params.name: files.content
params.description: The content of the file.

params.name: description
params.description: A descriptive name for this gist.

params.name: public
params.description: When `true`, the gist will be public and available for anyone to see.

hello_world.rb.content:
class HelloWorld
   def initialize(name)
      @name = name.capitalize
   end
   def sayHi
      puts "Hello !"
   end
end

hello = HelloWorld.new("World")
hello.sayHi

hello_world_ruby.txt.content: Run `ruby hello_world.rb` to print Hello World

hello_world_python.txt.content: Run `python hello_world.py` to print Hello World

description:
Allows you to add a new gist with one or more files.

**Note:** Don't name your files "gistfile" with a numerical suffix. This is the format of the automatic naming scheme that Gist uses internally.

hello_world.rb.content:
class HelloWorld
   def initialize(name)
      @name = name.capitalize
   end
   def sayHi
      puts "Hello !"
   end
end

hello = HelloWorld.new("World")
hello.sayHi

hello_world_ruby.txt.content: Run `ruby hello_world.rb` to print Hello World

hello_world_python.txt.content: Run `python hello_world.py` to print Hello World

name: Edit a gist

params.name: description
params.description: A descriptive name for this gist.

params.name: files
params.description: The filenames and content that make up this gist.

params.name: files.content
params.description: The updated content of the file.

params.name: files.filename
params.description: The new name for this file. To delete a file, set the value of the filename to `null`.

hello_world_ruby.txt.content: Run `ruby hello_world.rb` or `python hello_world.py` to print Hello World

new_file.txt.content: This is a new placeholder file.

description: Allows you to update or delete a gist file and rename gist files. Files from the previous version of the gist that aren't explicitly changed during an edit are unchanged.

hello_world.rb.content:
class HelloWorld
   def initialize(name)
      @name = name.capitalize
   end
   def sayHi
      puts "Hello !"
   end
end

hello = HelloWorld.new("World")
hello.sayHi
